Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Happy Holidays, Dwight. But do not open it till Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're so pathetic. How long did this take you? Three hours?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Five minutes actually. I am a black belt in gift wrapping.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, no such thing. They don't give out black belts for things that are stupid. [scoffs] Well, I hope it was worth it, cause I'm gonna take it apart in about five minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think it'll take you a little longer than that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really? If I can skin a mule deer in less than ten minutes, I ought to be able to cut my -- [sets briefcase on desk and sits in chair, desk and chair are made of paper, Dwight crashes to the floor]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Eh...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. It's the largest one I have.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I will not be the big guy in the tiny hat. [Kevin is wearing the same hat]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: This is the first Christmas party I am throwing as head of the party planning committee. The theme is "Nights in Morocco". This isn't your grandmothers Christmas party. Unless of course she's from Morocco, in which case it's very accurate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Phyllis, do I need this invite to get in to the party?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Awesome. I think this is going to be the best Christmas party ever.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Angela. You're going to move this for the party right? It's not on theme.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's the nativity scene.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Alright. You can keep your camel, sheep, elephant and the north African king can stay. Everything else goes in the drawer.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I am not going to judge Phyllis for desecrating Christmas. There is one person who will though and Phyllis just stuffed him into a drawer.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I need you to get rid of the tree.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: But-

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't think it's blackmail. Angela just does what I ask her to do so I won't tell everyone that she's cheating on Andy with Dwight. I think for it to be black mail, it would have to be a formal letter.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah. You brought in your doll collection.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: These are not dolls, Jim. These are commodities. Same as gold or oil.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Every year I do research to determine which toy will be the most popular of the Christmas season. This year it's a doll. Half girl, half unicorn. Catchphrase: "My horn can pierce the sky". Pathetic. I bought out every store in the area over the last couple of weeks. And as lazy parents become desperate I will sell them for an enormous profit. Isn't that right princess? [makes doll nod]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's the Christmas spirit.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am simply punishing those parents that would wait till the last minute to get their child a gift. And such a genetically improbable one. Look at that. How does that happen? King has sex with a unicorn? Man with a horn has sex with a royal horse?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, is that Princess Unicorn? I thought they were all sold out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They are now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cool. [sings] My horn can pierce the sky.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is equal parts scotch, absinthe, rum, gin, vermouth, triple sec, and two packs of Splenda. Call it a one of everything.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [drinks] Oh... my... GOD!!! [laughs] Hit me again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright... One more time around the block.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I will grant you one wish.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I wish that you'd stop rubbing that lamp in that creepy way.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stupid. Everyone knows to ask for a hundred more wishes. [Pam laughs] Dumb.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [sitting on floor playing the sitar] Hey, hey... Ange... check it out. [sings] There's a place in France where the naked ladies dance. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Really Andy? It's Christmas and your singing about nudity and France.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [sings] There's a hole in the wall where the men can see it all.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim, Jim....

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is vodka and I mixed it with orange juice. I call it an orange-vod-juice...ka.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, that is delicious.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can't believe no ones thought of that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [dancing drunkenly] Ahh yeah!!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [continuing to dance, lifting her shirt] Belly dancing!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: Thank you so much. My daughter is going to love this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, so glad I could help.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: You too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fa-la-la-la-la-la-la-ka-ching.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] Oh, so this is what every day would be like if you hadn't left India.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Meredith's hair is on fire] Oh, oh, oh, oh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We got a live one! On fire!! [Dwight extinguishes Meredith]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'm all right. I'm all right.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We're back on the 5th, should we just do it then?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can not do it then. Monthly dental appointment, soft teeth

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What about February 2nd?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah... would you want to do it on Groundhogs day?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. I celebrate privately.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't we just do it now? We'll do it quickly.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Now? It's our Christmas party.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We'll do it quickly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well what if we can't do it quickly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [mimicking] What if we can't do it quickly? What if we cant do it-

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Do you know how to do an intervention?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, shut up. Here we go. Everybody gather up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: An intervention. It's sort of hard to describe, but really its- it's a coming together... it's a surprise party for people who are- who have addictions. And you get in their face and you scream at them and you make them feel really badly about themselves. And then they stop.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It looks like we're going to be here for awhile, so why don't you make a little plate of hummus for everyone. Little triangles of pita, toasted on both sides, fanned so you can easily can grab them.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't-

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: And napkins... fanned.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, how do you feel?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: A little better. I threw up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uck... T.M.I.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Fire girl. [looks around] Too soon?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what I thought we should do is have a quick intervention and then get back to the party.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael, we are only allowed to talk about Meredith's work performance. We can not ask her to stop drinking.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am not asking her to stop drinking. I am imploring her to quit being an alcoholic.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'm not an alcoholic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, obviously you are. Okay, everybody who thinks that Meredith is an alcoholic please raise your hand. [everyone raises their hand]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aye.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The aye's have it.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I don't care what everyone thinks. I know I am not an alcoholic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, well, let's look at this a little bit closer then shall we? [pulls a piece of paper out of his pocket]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: When I was in college I used to get wicked hammered. My nickname was puke. I would chug a fifth of socos, sneak into a frat party, polish off a few people's empties, some brewskies, some Jell-O shots, do some body shots off myself, pass out, wake up the next morning, puke, rally, more soco, head to class. Probably would have gotten expelled if I had let it affect my grades, but I aced all my courses. They called me Ace. It was totally awesome. Got straight B's. They called me Buzz.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Meredith, have you ever used alcohol to alter your mood or deliberately change your state of mind?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you sometimes have a drink to celebrate a special occasion or mark a holiday?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Obviously.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Have you ever under the influence of alcohol questioned the teachings of the Mormon church?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Where did you get this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I got it on a website, that's not important.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael, We should contact some experts. You don't know what your doing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what Toby? One of my employees is undergoing a crisis and I wish for just once you would take my side on this. I'm doing your job man. Hey, are you texting?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, 'cause this is kind of a drag.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alcohol is a drag. Yes. Here's what I'd like to do. I'd like to go around the room and have us each express to Meredith how her alcoholism has affected us. I'll begin. This Christmas party is perhaps the best Christmas party I have ever been to, but then you got so drunk that we had to stop and do this. That's how your drinking affected me. Anybody else? Another time when Meredith's drinking affected you? Come on people. If we don't say anything she's not going to get any better. [Kevin raises his hand] Yes, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, Meredith, there was that one time you bought movie tickets and then you got too drunk to go, so you gave them to me. And that was really cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's- you didn't- you weren't hurt by that.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, you said affected by it. Thanks again, Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, no, that's not what we're going for. Who has a problem with Meredith's drinking? It has to bother you. It bothers me. Right? How does it bother you? Dwight, don't you have anything?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I like Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Actually, I don't care for Meredith, but I don't believe in this kind of thing. In the Schrute family we believe in a five fingered intervention. [holds up his fist] Awareness, education, control, acceptance and punching.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who is going to tell us the latest dirty joke? Who is going to tell us what you watched on television last night?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I am fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Was John Belushi fine? Was Bob Hope fine? Hey- come here. If anything ever happened to you, I would be very angry at myself for not doing all that I could do.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I know I drink. I like to party

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want you to say I'm an alcoholic.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I am not an alcoholic!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can say it as loudly as you want, but we're not going to believe you.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I was waiting until later to hand out this years gifts from corporate. [holds up shot glass] I don't think they're appropriate anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Please stop making me do these things.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, sorry, it's your job.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: But it's the season of mercy.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You never showed me mercy when you were in charge. Why aren't you wearing the hairnet?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I lost it. [Phyllis glares at her until Angela pulls out the hairnet and puts it on]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ok... nice.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I don't mind telling you that I have an addiction. I do. To porn.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [amid groans from the rest of the office] Alright, no, no, no. No. That is the image, I think we can all agree is very disgusting. But you know what, Meredith, you lit your hair on fire today. What about tomorrow.? What is going to happen when you come into work and you're dead?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I stab her in the brain with a wooden stick.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There are several ways to kill a zombie, but the most satisfying one is to stab it in the brain with a wooden stick.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everyone in this room loves you, but mark my words, we are not going to support your alcoholism anymore. The next time you light yourself on fire we are not going to help put you out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, as fire marshal I would have to.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She is a hazard to the other people of the office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs]...okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I suppose I could do it if it was a controlled burn in a well ventilated area.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, but you're gonna need a permit for that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh right, that'll take a couple of weeks.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I can get you one in an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay you know, this- this is over.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I agree.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, I think... you did the best you could, but this is bigger than all of us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Enabler! Enabler, enabler, enabler, enabler, enabler. It's Christmas and we are turning our back on somebody who is asking for help.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what the only thing I want for Christmas? I want Meredith to get better. That's my only wish. But you know what? My wishes never come true, so I'm not going to wish that on her. I- a watch would be nice.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [watching Meredith and Michael talk in his office] They've been in there for 45 minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know. If she wasn't an alcoholic before, she is now. [Jim laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That's a halwa shabkia cookie. They serve it during Ramadan. [Angela spits her cookie out]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Mmmm... chewy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Andy playing the sitar] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you take requests?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Please stop. People are having a Christmas party.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whispers to Meredith] I'll be down in a minute. [walks over to Toby] Could you write down the number of that rehabilitation center that you mentioned?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Sure. Wow. [Michael throws a pen at his head] Ow...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: We just missed Poor Richards.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We did?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah, I thought we were going out for a drink?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, shoot. Oh well, we'll have to go someplace else then I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: The Bog? Cooper's, Kelly's...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We could go there, sure.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: ...Brixx's, Carmen's...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: ...The Fort, Andy Gavin's.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have a new place.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Well, it must have just opened up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It- yep, recently.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah... all right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Enough of this Christmas crap. Let's get some party music. [changes radio station] Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, oh there you go.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's good.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah that's better.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're party girls.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hey Sasha, it's daddy. Have you ever heard of this doll , Princess Unicorn?

Quote.Speaker: Sasha
Quote.Text: [shouting excitedly over the phone] Daddy, daddy, daddy!!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, No, No. No, I'm just curious if you've heard of it.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: This is great. My ex-wife's going to be so pissed. [chuckles] For once daddy's gonna be a hero.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yo.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, I'd like to buy one of your dolls.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, that's my last one.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, no, I- no, no, I was gonna buy that doll.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Thanks man.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I was- I was gonna get the doll.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not my problem.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: But I- I promised my daughter. Darryl, look- I- I need the doll, I need the doll. I- I'm- I'm begging you. I just- I need it more than anything in this world. I need this doll. Darryl, man I need this doll.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: All right man, don't cry. It's cool. I'll let you get it for $400.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I only have $200.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You can owe me.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [laughs] Oh man, thanks, thank you, [tearing up] thank you, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I know, right. Merry Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh thanks. She's gonna... [notices the doll is black] oh...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Something wrong with the doll?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No. It's even- it's even better than the one I wanted.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Sunrise Rehab? No! No! No! I told you no! There is no way!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's okay. It's all right.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No way! There is no way! No way!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Meredith, we are doing this for your own good. Okay. Come on-

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No way! No way! There is no way!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go. This is gonna be good.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No! No way! I told you. We talked about this. There is absolutely no way. No! No! There is no way! No! No! I am not going in there! I am not going in there!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes you are. [tries to pull Meredith from the car]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I am not going in there! NO!!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Just wait! Just wait!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shhh... just calm down.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [runs away] Oh my God! Oh my God! Oh my God! No! No!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [chasing Meredith] Come on. Shh...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No! No! No! There is no way! There is no way!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here's the door. Here's the door.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: There is no way! There is no way! No! No!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [dragging Meredith on the floor into the rehab center] Let's start meeting- Hello. How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: This man is crazy! This man is crazy!

Quote.Speaker: Rehab Nurse
Quote.Text: Can I help you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have a deposit. Alcoholic.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No! No! No! No! No!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So do I sign?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: NO!!!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I need you to put the Christmas tree back up.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's outside.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I didn't ask you where it was. I told you where it needs to be.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Shut up.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm not moving the tree. Face it. The only power you have over me is this big secret that I know you're not going to tell. And you want to know how I know that? Because then you won't be able to plan your stupid, tacky parties anymore. So you move the tree.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Okay. [starts to walk away, then turns around] Angela's having sex with Dwight. I caught them doing it after Toby's going away party.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well don't look so surprised.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I knew it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You did not know it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I knew some of it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Everyone knew some of it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You knew it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you. I knew it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She knew it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: As it turns out you can't just check someone into rehab against their will. They have to do it voluntarily. They have to hit rock bottom. So I think I know what I need to do at this point. I need to find ways to push Meredith to the bottom. Um... I think I can do it. I did it with Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right, everybody's still here. Perfect! Got a little surprise I've been working on. Angela, my bride, I just wanted you to know that for the rest of our lives, no matter the cultural milieu, I will always be there to bring you Christmas cheer. [sings] Deck the halls with boughs of holly. Fa-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la. Tis the season to be jolly. Fa-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la. Don we now our gay apparel. Fa-la-la-la-la-LA. Troll the little Yule tide carol. Roo-di-di-di-do. Roododododo. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I think I'd like to go home now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sure. Dooo. Tough room. [chuckles] Come on. I just learned it. Just so you know protocol is a little round of applause. But, Merry Christmas to all, and to all a good night.
